description: The Duchess of Kent, Katharine, passed away peacefully at Kensington Palace on Thursday night at the age of 92. Married to Prince Edward, Duke of Kent, in 1961, she became the oldest living Royal Family member after Queen Elizabeth's death. Remembered for her compassion, especially at Wimbledon, and dedication to music and youth welfare, the Royal Family mourns her loss.

Prime Minister Keir Starmer accepted her resignation, acknowledging her decision to refer herself to the independent adviser.

Google and Trump are still in legal discussions over YouTube censorship.

title: 'Misleading': India rejects Navarro's 'Brahmins' remark; calls it 'inaccurate'

The statement, linking India's oil purchases to funding Russia's war in Ukraine, has sparked widespread criticism across Indian political parties. Even Trump's comments on India's relationship with Russia and China at the SCO summit, adding fuel to the fire.

White House dinner: Melania Trump warns, ‘Our future is no longer science fiction’
description: President Trump convened tech leaders, including Cook, Zuckerberg, and Pichai, to discuss AI's future. Melania Trump emphasized preparing children for an AI-driven world, advocating for its careful guidance. Tech CEOs lauded the administration's AI Action Plan and investments, with Google and Microsoft pledging significant financial contributions to the U.S. economy.

title: AI could cause ‘99% unemployment by 2030’, warns computer science professor
Aizawl to Silchar in just 3 hours: Bairabi-Sairang railway line set to improve connectivity in Northeast

Google’s Circle to Search gets smarter with new ‘Scroll and Translate’ feature
Op Sindoor: CDS explains why India used air power; how targets were selected
description: CDS Anil Chauhan stated that India employed air power in Operation Sindoor to dismantle terrorist camps in Bahawalpur and Muridke, as drones and loitering munitions were deemed insufficient to achieve the desired political objectives. This decision followed the Pahalgam terror attack and reflected India's enhanced precision strike capabilities developed after the Balakot operation.

title: Looks like we have lost India and Russia to deepest, darkest China: Trump
As Baaghi 4 resorts to a ‘buy one, get one free’ offer, Sanjay Gupta slams ‘big star’ Tiger Shroff: ‘What times are we living in?’
UPSC Issue at a Glance | SCO Summit 2025 and India: 4 Key Questions You Must Know for Prelims and Mains
‘We are adivasis, not Hindus’: Row over top Congress leader’s comment in Madhya Pradesh
Unbelievable! Tickets at Rs 100 - Women's WC sets record with lowest prices in history
description: The ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup 2025 is set to break barriers with ticket prices starting at a record low of Rs 100. An exclusive pre-sale window is already open until September 8. Shreya Ghoshal will headline the opening ceremony in Guwahati on September 30, performing the tournament anthem “Bring it Home.

title: Married to T-Series top boss, Divya Khossla was made to live in a slum, was given a hut next to a gutter: ‘It was in your fate,’ says Parmeet Sethi
Gujarat govt organises ‘Blood Moon’ sky-watching sessions on September 7-8. Here’s all you need to know
'Highest respect for police force': Ajit Pawar on 'rebuking' women IPS officer
description: Maharashtra's Deputy CM Ajit Pawar faced criticism after a video surfaced showing him allegedly reprimanding a female IPS officer for taking action against illegal soil excavation in Solapur. Pawar clarified that his intention was to maintain calm and not interfere with law enforcement, emphasising his respect for the police force.

title: Malaika Arora sells luxury Andheri West apartment for Rs 5.30 crore, makes Rs 2 crore profit
Mid-air scare: AI Express' Delhi-Indore flight issues PAN-PAN call over engine fault
description: An Air India Express flight from Delhi to Indore experienced an engine problem mid-air. The pilot sent a 'PAN-PAN' alert. This signaled a non-critical emergency. The plane landed safely in Indore with a slight delay. Airport authorities took precautions. All 161 passengers and crew are safe. The aircraft landed at Devi Ahilyabai Holkar Airport.

title: Shreyas Iyer joins Carlos Alcaraz, Caitlin Clark, Vinicius Jr and Scottie Scheffler in Nike’s ‘Why do it?’ campaign
New Ebola outbreak in Congo suspected of causing 15 deaths
On Teachers’ Day, a question: Can AI be adopted into the classroom without losing the core ideals of teaching?
Cardiologist lists everyday habits that are ‘actually affecting your heart — and nobody’s talking about it’
AI scams surge in India: Voice cloning, deepfakes and OTP frauds leave victims helpless
Aishwarya & Abhishek shielded Aaradhya from media: Pap reveals more
description: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Abhishek Bachchan's daughter, Aaradhya, was a subject of immense public curiosity after her birth in 2011. Paparazzo Manav Manglani recounted the frenzy to capture her first photo, revealing the lengths photographers went to, given Aishwarya's initial protectiveness.

title: Injured Sandesh Jhingan in medical care in Goa after suffering cheekbone fracture during CAFA Nations Cup
Who is Karol G? Colombian superstar shines; chiefs vs chargers halftime show
description: The National Football League's 2025 season expands to Brazil. Sao Paulo will host a game between Kansas City Chiefs and Los Angeles Chargers. Colombian singer Karol G will perform at the halftime show. The performance will stream live on YouTube. Ana Castela will sing the Brazilian national anthem. Kamasi Washington will deliver the U.S. anthem.

title: ‘How can Marathas avail multiple quotas?’: Prakash Ambedkar lashes out at Fadnavis Government over assurance to Manoj Jarange Patil
Trump’s 'high-IQ' tech dinner: Indian-origin CEOs shine; AI and US investments highlighted
description: At a White House dinner hosted by President Trump, five Indian-origin tech executives, including Sundar Pichai and Satya Nadella, were recognized for their significant influence in the US tech sector. These leaders, representing companies like Google, Microsoft, and Micron Technology, highlighted their contributions to AI and innovation.

title: Gun in wrong hand, family feud over marriage: How cops uncovered ‘honour killing’ in Hardoi
US Open: 'Goldfish' Amanda Anisimova goes from rock bottom to cusp of success
description: Amanda Anisimova has learned to forget, reset, and fight again. Just 54 days after her crushing 0-6, 0-6 Wimbledon final loss, the 24-year-old American is back on the biggest stage — this time at the US Open. With belief, grit, and booming winners, she now stands one match away from her first Grand Slam crown, just 61 miles from where she was born.

title: Madharaasi movie review: This Sivakarthikeyan starrer is too formulaic and old fashioned for its own good
Baaghi 4 Movie Review: Tiger Shroff bleeds, Sanjay Dutt snarls, you flinch
Lenovo Legion Go 2 debuts with detachable controllers and VRR screen
Qualcomm teams up with BMW to launch new Snapdragon Ride advanced driving system in iX3
From fascism to fashion: how war-ravaged Italy shaped Giorgio Armani and his legacy
Mike Tyson and Floyd Mayweather: Fight date set; latest details out
description: Boxing legends Mike Tyson and Floyd Mayweather Jr. are set to clash in an exhibition match in Spring 2026, confirmed by CSI Sports/Fight Sports. The highly anticipated event pits Tyson's aggressive style against Mayweather's defensive prowess. Both fighters have expressed excitement and surprise, promising a legendary showdown for fans worldwide, though the specific date and venue remain undisclosed.

title: ‘Will be legitimate targets’: Vladimir Putin warns of direct attacks in Ukraine
description: President Putin warned that any Western troops deployed to Ukraine would be considered legitimate targets, following pledges of postwar security guarantees including an international force. He argued such deployments wouldn't ensure lasting peace, citing growing military ties as a conflict root cause. Macron criticized Russia's troop movements despite ceasefire talks. Recent large-scale Russian attacks targeted Western Ukraine.

title: Watch: Army's daring night evacuation in Ladakh; 2 South Korean nationals rescued
description: The Indian Army swiftly responded to a distress call on September 4th, launching a rescue operation to evacuate two South Korean nationals stranded at the Kongmarula Pass in Ladakh. Helicopters were deployed within 15 minutes of receiving the request, successfully airlifting the individuals from the high-altitude location around 9:15 pm.

title: 'Locked himself in bathroom': This actor recalls school bullying; shares story
description: Hrithik Roshan, celebrated for his acting, dance, and looks, overcame a difficult childhood marked by stuttering and a spinal problem that doctors said would prevent him from becoming an actor. He faced immense challenges, including locking himself in a bathroom to practice speaking without stammering.

title: 6 murders and counting – the heavy price of being a temporary teacher in Chhattisgarh
Messi not playing WC 2026? He says: 'It's only logical to think I might not'
description: Lionel Messi is uncertain about participating in the 2026 World Cup to defend Argentina's title, citing his age and physical condition as key factors. After scoring twice in a 3-0 victory against Venezuela, the 38-year-old stated he will assess his fitness and performance throughout the upcoming season before making a final decision.

title: Rs 60 crore 'cheating case': Lookout circular for Shilpa Shetty, Raj Kundra
description: Mumbai police have issued a Lookout Circular against Shilpa Shetty and Raj Kundra concerning a Rs 60 crore cheating case. The Economic Offences Wing took this action due to the couple's frequent international travel. The case, registered at Juhu police station, alleges they defrauded a businessman in a loan-cum-investment deal.

title: Before Madharaasi, examining the social issue based commercial cinema of A R Murugadoss
FIDE Grand Swiss Chess highlights, Round 2: Gukesh held to draw by 14-year-old Turkish prodigy; Vaishali, Pragg, Arjun Erigaisi win

Patralekhaa recalls ‘very difficult’ process of freezing her eggs, says her pregnancy ‘is easier’: ‘I put on weight, the blues I had’
Sunil Dutt slapped Sanjay Dutt when he revealed his acting ambition; Sanju ranks himself 15 out of 10 as a husband
'Bidi-Bihar' row: Deleted Cong post on GST sparks backlash; BJP hits back
description: A social media post by the Kerala Congress linking GST reforms to Bihar has ignited a political firestorm. The now-deleted post, referencing reduced taxes on bidis, was slammed by BJP and JD(U) leaders as an insult to the state and its people. The controversy has intensified ahead of Bihar's assembly elections, with the BJP-JD(U) alliance using it to attack Congress.

title: AI Express’ Delhi-Indore flight suffers engine fault, pilot makes PAN-PAN call; plane lands safely

J-K highway shut for fourth day due to multiple landslides; Mughal Road reopens
After days of alarm, Bhakra Dam water level dips slightly, bringing relief to Punjab
GST 2.0: Full comprehensive list of items with revised rates
description: New GST rates 2025 full list: The Finance Minister announced significant GST rate cuts and slab changes, effective September 22, 2025, leading to cheaper daily-use items. Many food items will attract 0% GST, and life and health insurance will also see zero tax. The government is monitoring price changes, while luxury and sin goods may face higher taxes, potentially reaching a 40% bracket.

title: Pension hikes to business grants, Nitish Kumar goes all out for women’s votes in Bihar polls
Violation of natural justice principles and due process: Punjab and Haryana HC sets aside ₹2 crore penalty on Gurgaon developer BPTP
Shilpa Shetty’s husband Raj Kundra accepts marriage is the ‘hardest thing’: ‘The love melts away after 1-2 years’
Maharashtra minister becomes 1st Tesla owner: Pratak Sarnaik takes 'Y' model home
description: Maharashtra Transport Minister Pratap Sarnaik received the first Tesla Model Y in Mumbai, aiming to promote electric vehicle adoption. He intends to gift the car to his grandson, fostering early awareness of green mobility. Maharashtra is committed to EV transition with incentives and MSRTC's procurement of 5,000 e-buses, aligning with the Prime Minister's clean mobility vision.

title: Knowledge Nugget: What is GST Council, and what were key decisions taken during its 56th meeting? Here’s everything you need to know for UPSC exam
In a first for Karnataka, special MP/MLA court hears Bengaluru organised crime murder case where BJP’s Byrathi Basavaraj is accused
Indian-American investor predicts global markets will beat the US in 5–10 years: ‘The only reason for investing in the US today is…’
Sri Lanka bus crash leaves 15 dead
‘Illegitimate targeting’: US puts sanctions on Palestinian rights groups
description: The U.S. sanctioned three Palestinian human rights organizations for allegedly instigating the International Criminal Court's (ICC) investigation into Israel, according to the Treasury Department. Secretary Rubio stated the groups targeted Israeli nationals without consent, prompting the action. The ICC's later arrest warrants for Israeli and Hamas leaders over war crimes allegations further fueled the controversy.

title: China’s Victory Day parade reveals the PLA’s transformation
Huawei unveils second generation of Mate XTs, their trifold smartphones
Clash over 'samosas': UP man thrashed with kicks and punches by wife, in-laws
description: In Pilibhit, a domestic dispute over samosas turned violent when Shivam Kumar failed to bring them home as requested by his wife, Sangeeta. The argument escalated the next day, leading to Sangeeta, along with her parents and uncle, allegedly assaulting Shivam. Police have registered an FIR, and an investigation is underway to determine the full scope of the incident.

title: Who is Mitesh Khapra? The IIT Madras professor featured in TIME Magazine
description: Mitesh Khapra, IIT Madras professor, features in TIME's 2025 AI 100 list. He is recognised for NLP and machine learning contributions. Khapra focuses on AI systems for India's diverse languages. His work addresses challenges in English-centric AI models. He aims to make AI accessible across India. AI4Bharat, his project, builds datasets for Indian languages. This initiative supports government's Bhashini mission.

title: 6 animals that are found deep inside caves and nowhere else in the world
India’s quick response to earthquake in Afghanistan speaks of it as an emerging leader in providing food aid
Karan Johar admits Dharma doesn’t make much profit, says his P&L statements leave people shocked: ‘Is that it?’
Is it a bank holiday on September 5? Check details
description: Banks across multiple Indian states remained closed on September 5 due to Id-E-Milad and Thiruvonam, as per the RBI holiday calendar. While digital banking services continued uninterrupted, physical branch visits were necessary for certain transactions. Maharashtra, however, shifted the Eid-e-Milad holiday in Mumbai to September 8, 2025, impacting government securities and related markets.

title: ‘Will restore Amma’s rule’: Sasikala rakes up AIADMK unity debate; signals political comeback
description: VK Sasikala has reignited the AIADMK leadership debate, asserting the party's need for unity to challenge the DMK in the 2026 elections. Senior leader K A Sengottaiyan supports Sasikala, urging EPS to reconcile with former members.

title: ‘Act immediately’: over 4,000 scientists, including Nobel laureates, issue statement urging to ‘halt tragedy’ in Gaza
Shah Rukh Khan cracked IIT entrance exam, never pursued engineering: ‘My mom said show it to me and I did’
Ufff Yeh Siyapaa movie review: Two hours of drivel
UP man vanished after a 1999 murder in Saudi Arabia. 26 years later, CBI found him
US Open: Yuki Bhambri’s dream of reaching first Major final ends in heartbreaking men’s doubles semifinals defeat
In Manipur, consent is the key to reset
Bestselling author James Patterson launches $500,000 programme to help writers finish their books
Only one man can identify Mohammed Rafi’s unmarked grave in Mumbai; graves of Madhubala, Sahir Ludhianvi were dug up and destroyed
A lifetime of lessons: Remembering the teachers who changed us
Top 10 most and least powerful passports based on mobility scores in 2025: UAE best, Pakistan remains weakest, where does India stand?
Yagiz Kaan Erdogmus, who held Gukesh to draw today, once beat Magnus Carlsen in 41 seconds in blitz game
Inspector Zende movie review: Manoj Bajpayee-Jim Sarbh’s patchy film fails to leave an impact
Gujarat: Ajwa, Kadana, Narmada dams release water; over 160 villages on alert
34 ‘human bombs’ carrying ‘400 kg of RDX’: Mumbai police on alert after threat message
NIRF 2025 Top 10 State Public Universities: Jadavpur, Anna University lead
Joe Biden undergoes skin cancer surgery, fresh videos show head wound - watch
description: Ex-US President, Joe Biden, was recently spotted with a visible mark on his head. Reports confirm that the 82-year-old underwent Mohs surgery for skin cancer treatment. Biden was seen leaving a church in Rehoboth Beach with a bandage. Earlier, he was seen wearing a cap to conceal the wound. In May, aides disclosed Biden's diagnosis of Stage 4 prostate cancer. Biden shared a message about strength in difficult times.

title: '34 vehicles ready with human bombs': Lashkar-e-Jihadi sends warning; Mumbai on high alert
description: Mumbai Police are on high alert. A threat message warned of multiple terror attacks. The message claimed 34 vehicles are fitted with human bombs. Lashkar-e-Jihadi claimed responsibility. They said 14 Pakistani terrorists entered India. The threat mentioned 400 kg of RDX explosives. Mumbai Police are investigating the threat. Security has been tightened across the city.

title: Exclusive | From Rs 1 coins to defeating Divya Deshmukh: Abhimanyu Puranik’s journey
description: Divya Deshmukh, after her Women's World Cup victory, revealed her mentors, Csaba Balogh and Abhimanyu Puranik. At the Grand Swiss 2025, Puranik, who had just enjoyed a Disneyland vacation, defeated his protégé, Divya. Puranik, a Mumbai-born Punekar, started chess at five and praised Divya's amazing mentality and potential for future dominance in Indian chess.

title: 'Department of war': Why Trump wants to rename Pentagon; executive order likely today
description: President Trump is set to sign an executive order allowing the Pentagon to be referred to as the "Department of War," a secondary designation endorsed by Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth. Trump hinted at the change, recalling the department's historical name during World Wars. This move follows Hegseth's actions to reverse earlier policies, including reattributing Confederate-era fort names.

title: NIRF 2025: IIM Ahmedabad ranks first again in management, check top 10 here
description: IIM Ahmedabad has secured the top spot in the NIRF 2025 management institute rankings for the sixth consecutive year. IIM Bangalore and IIM Kozhikode follow closely behind. While IIMs dominate, non-IIMs like IIT Delhi's DMS, MDI Gurgaon, and XLRI Jamshedpur also feature in the top 10, showcasing a diverse range of quality management education options in India.

title: From plush to slush: Yamuna floodwaters swamp Noida’s luxury farmhouses
description: Rising Yamuna floodwaters have submerged luxury farmhouses along the Noida floodplain, reviving memories of last year's devastating inundation. Caretakers are evacuating properties as the river approaches record levels, impacting over 1,000 farmhouses with lavish amenities.

title: Tim Cook, Sundar Pichai and more: Trump hosts White House dinner; Musk absent
description: US president Trump hosted tech leaders, including Bill Gates and Mark Zuckerberg, at the White House to discuss AI and US investments. The meeting highlighted the growing influence of Indian-American executives in Silicon Valley. Trump downplayed jobs data, mentioned speaking with Putin, and Google's CEO expressed relief over the antitrust case's end.

title: NIRF rankings 2025: Hindu, Miranda House remain best two colleges of India
description: Delhi University (DU) continues its dominance in the NIRF 2025 rankings, securing top positions with 32 colleges on the list. Hindu College and Miranda House retain their top spots, while DU achieves its best-ever fifth position among universities. Other Delhi institutions like JNU and Jamia Millia Islamia also shine, with AIIMS Delhi leading in medical and dental categories.

title: 'Phone call' halts mining crackdown: Trouble for Ajit Pawar over ‘threat’ to cop?
description: Maharashtra's Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar faces accusations of obstructing IPS officer Anjana Krishna's efforts to curb illegal sand mining in Solapur. A video circulating online purportedly captures Pawar instructing Krishna to halt action against an NCP member involved. Opposition leaders are demanding an apology, alleging Pawar threatened the officer after she insisted on verifying his identity.

title: GST rate cut: TVs, ACs, laptops see relief; what happens to mobile phones
description: The GST Council has approved a revised two-tier rate structure, reducing the slabs to 5% and 18%, effective September 22. Consumer electronics like TVs, air conditioners, and dishwashers will see a price cut as they move from the 28% to the 18% GST slab. However, mobile phones and laptops will continue to be taxed at 18%.
